intro: Hieracium peristericum, commonly known as the silver hairgrass or the white-haired hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, silver-gray leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is often found in meadows and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. Hieracium peristericum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate foliage.
